description: A professor uploads a research methods PDF, the system extracts concepts, creates slide decks with example designs, generates scenario‑based MCQs, builds a linear SCORM package, validates it, stores it, and returns a download link.

messages.content: You are EduScormBuilder, an agentic LLM that helps educators turn raw teaching materials into SCORM‑compatible interactive modules. Use the provided tools to upload files, extract text, identify key concepts, generate assessments, assemble a SCORM package, validate it, and give the user a downloadable link.

Hello! I have a PDF of my "Advanced Research Methods" chapter (≈30 pages). I’d like an interactive SCORM module that walks students through the main research steps, shows example study designs, and ends with scenario‑based multiple‑choice questions.
Great! Please upload the PDF file and I’ll start processing it.
Thanks for the upload. I’m extracting the plain text from the PDF so I can identify the core concepts.

I’ve extracted the text and identified the major steps and example designs. Next I’ll pull out the key concepts and suggest slide titles.

arguments.text:
Chapter 3 – Research Design

1. Formulating the research question
2. Choosing a design (experimental, quasi‑experimental, observational)
3. Defining variables and operationalization
4. Sampling strategies (probability vs. non‑probability)
5. Data collection methods (surveys, interviews, case studies)
6. Ethical considerations
7. Data analysis plans (statistical tests, coding schemes)
8. Reporting results

Example Study Designs:
- Randomized Controlled Trial in educational interventions
- Cross‑sectional survey on health behaviors
- Longitudinal case study of organizational change

Key terms: independent variable, dependent variable, confounder, validity, reliability, bias, power analysis.

slides.title: Defining the Research Question
slides.html_body:
Defining the Research Question

A clear, focused question guides the entire study. Example: \"What is the effect of blended learning on student achievement?\"

slides.title: Choosing a Design
slides.html_body:
Choosing a Design

Overview of experimental, quasi‑experimental, and observational designs with pros/cons.

slides.title: Operationalizing Variables
slides.html_body:
Operationalizing Variables

Translate concepts into measurable indicators. Example: \"Student achievement\" measured by final exam scores.

slides.title: Sampling Techniques
slides.html_body:
Sampling Techniques

Probability vs. non‑probability sampling; how to calculate sample size.

slides.title: Collecting Data
slides.html_body:
Collecting Data

Surveys, interviews, observations; considerations for reliability.

slides.title: Ethics in Research
slides.html_body:
Ethics in Research

Informed consent, confidentiality, IRB approval.

slides.title: Analyzing Data
slides.html_body:
Analyzing Data

Selecting appropriate statistical tests; coding qualitative data.

slides.title: Writing the Report
slides.html_body:
Writing the Report

Structure of APA style papers; presenting results and discussion.
